required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nab-paclitaxel Combined With S-1 as Adjuvant Chemotherapy for Stage Ⅲ Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Adjuvant Nab-paclitaxel Plus S-1 Versus Capecitabine Plus Oxaliplatin for Patients With Stage III Gastric Cancer After D2 Gastrectomy : a Randomised，Open-label, Phase III Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label phase III study. The treatment was compare the efficacy and safety of Albumin-bound Paclitaxel plus S-1 versus Oxaliplatin plus capecitabine (XELOX) treating stage Ⅲ gastric cancer as adjuvant setting

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label phase III study. The treatment was compare the efficacy and safety of Albumin-bound Paclitaxel plus S-1 versus Oxaliplatin plus capecitabine (XELOX) treating stage Ⅲ gastric cancer as adjuvant setting. The primary endpoint is the 3-year diseases-free survival (DFS) rate. The secondary endpoints are the overall survival (OS) and safety.

primary_outcome.description: DFS is defined as time from the date of inclusion up to the date of disease progression or death

secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as time from the start of treatment until death due to any reason.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as measured by number and grade of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Summary adverse events according to NCI-CTCAE 5.0

arm_group.description: Arm A：nab paclitaxel （120mg/m2；iv；d1，8）+S-1 （<1.25 m2, 40 mg; 1.25 to ≤1.5 m2, 50 mg; and ≥ 1.5 m2, 60 mg；po；d1-14 bid）Q3W；up to eight cycles
Arm B：Capetabine（1000 mg/m2 po, d1-14 bid ）+ Oxaliplatin（130mg/m2 , iv, d1）Q3W；up to eight cycles

overall_official.affiliation: Zhejiang Cancer Hospital；Cancer hospital of the university of chinese academy of sciences

facility.name: Zhejiang Cancer Hospital；Cancer hospital of the university of chinese academy of sciences
